subject: Writing
title: Amazon KDP: The Great Equalizer
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Amazon KDP: The Great Equalizer.

hook.text: Amazon let anyone publish a book for free. Overnight, the gates that publishers guarded for centuries fell.

buildup.text: Kindle Direct Publishing (KDP), launched in 2007, allowed any author to upload and sell an e-book worldwide.

discovery.text: Authors kept up to 70% of royalties â€” compared to 10-15% from traditional publishers. The economics flipped.

twist.text: The flood of content created a discovery problem â€” millions of books but no way for readers to find the good ones.

climax.text: KDP democratized publishing but created a new challenge: in a world where everyone can publish, how do you stand out?

punchline.text: Anyone can publish a book now. Getting it read is the new challenge.

quiz.question: What royalty rate can authors earn through Amazon KDP?
